urls.title: Neonicotinoids: risks to bees confirmed
urls.description: Most uses of neonicotinoid pesticides represent a risk to wild bees and honeybees, according to assessments published today by EFSA. The Authority has updated its risk assessments of three neonicotinoids ‚Äì clothianidin, imidacloprid and thiamethoxam ‚Äì that are currently subject to restrictions in the EU because of the threat they pose to bees. These new conclusions update those published in 2013, after which the European Commission imposed controls on use of the substances. For the new assessments, which this time cover wild bees ‚Äì bumblebees and solitary bees ‚Äì as well as honeybees, EFSA‚Äôs...
